Events.html: 41 – After a night of negotiation, Claudius is accepted as Roman Emperor by the Senate.
Events.text: After a night of negotiation, Claudius is accepted as Roman Emperor by the Senate.

Events.html: 750 – In the Battle of the Zab, the Abbasid rebels defeat the Umayyad Caliphate, leading to overthrow of the dynasty.
Events.text: In the Battle of the Zab, the Abbasid rebels defeat the Umayyad Caliphate, leading to overthrow of the dynasty.

Events.html: 1348 – A strong earthquake strikes the South Alpine region of Friuli in modern Italy, causing considerable damage to buildings as far away as Rome.
Events.text: A strong earthquake strikes the South Alpine region of Friuli in modern Italy, causing considerable damage to buildings as far away as Rome.

Events.html: 1494 – Alfonso II becomes King of Naples.
Events.text: Alfonso II becomes King of Naples.

Events.html: 1515 – Coronation of Francis I of France.
Events.text: Coronation of Francis I of France.

Events.html: 1533 – Henry VIII of England secretly marries his second wife Anne Boleyn.
Events.text: Henry VIII of England secretly marries his second wife Anne Boleyn.

Events.html: 1554 – Founding of São Paulo city, Brazil.
Events.text: Founding of São Paulo city, Brazil.

Events.html: 1573 – Battle of Mikatagahara: In Japan, Takeda Shingen defeats Tokugawa Ieyasu.
Events.text: Battle of Mikatagahara: In Japan, Takeda Shingen defeats Tokugawa Ieyasu.

Events.html: 1575 – Luanda, the capital of Angola, is founded by the Portuguese navigator Paulo Dias de Novais.
Events.text: Luanda, the capital of Angola, is founded by the Portuguese navigator Paulo Dias de Novais.

Events.html: 1704 – The Battle of Ayubale results in the destruction of most of the Spanish missions in Florida.
Events.text: The Battle of Ayubale results in the destruction of most of the Spanish missions in Florida.

Events.html: 1755 – Moscow University is established on Tatiana Day.
Events.text: Moscow University is established on Tatiana Day.

Events.html: 1765 – Port Egmont, the first British settlement in the Falkland Islands at the southern tip of South America, is founded.
Events.text: Port Egmont, the first British settlement in the Falkland Islands at the southern tip of South America, is founded.

Events.html: 1787 – Shays' Rebellion: The rebellion's largest confrontation, outside the Springfield Armory, results in the killing of four rebels and the wounding of twenty.
Events.text: Shays' Rebellion: The rebellion's largest confrontation, outside the Springfield Armory, results in the killing of four rebels and the wounding of twenty.

Events.html: 1791 – The British Parliament passes the Constitutional Act of 1791 and splits the old Province of Quebec into Upper and Lower Canada.
Events.text: The British Parliament passes the Constitutional Act of 1791 and splits the old Province of Quebec into Upper and Lower Canada.

Events.html: 1792 – The London Corresponding Society is founded.
Events.text: The London Corresponding Society is founded.

Events.html: 1858 – The Wedding March by Felix Mendelssohn is played at the marriage of Queen Victoria's daughter, Victoria, and Friedrich of Prussia, and becomes a popular wedding recessional.
Events.text: The Wedding March by Felix Mendelssohn is played at the marriage of Queen Victoria's daughter, Victoria, and Friedrich of Prussia, and becomes a popular wedding recessional.

links.subject: Victoria
links.title: Victoria, Princess Royal and Empress Frederick

Events.html: 1879 – The Bulgarian National Bank is founded.
Events.text: The Bulgarian National Bank is founded.

Events.html: 1881 – Thomas Edison and Alexander Graham Bell form the Oriental Telephone Company.
Events.text: Thomas Edison and Alexander Graham Bell form the Oriental Telephone Company.

Events.html: 1890 – Nellie Bly completes her round-the-world journey in 72 days.
Events.text: Nellie Bly completes her round-the-world journey in 72 days.

Events.html: 1909 – Richard Strauss's opera Elektra receives its debut performance at the Dresden State Opera.
Events.text: Richard Strauss's opera Elektra receives its debut performance at the Dresden State Opera.

Events.html: 1915 – Alexander Graham Bell inaugurates U.S. transcontinental telephone service, speaking from New York to Thomas Watson in San Francisco.
Events.text: Alexander Graham Bell inaugurates U.S. transcontinental telephone service, speaking from New York to Thomas Watson in San Francisco.

Events.html: 1918 – Ukraine declares independence from Bolshevik Russia.
Events.text: Ukraine declares independence from Bolshevik Russia.

Events.html: 1919 – The League of Nations is founded.
Events.text: The League of Nations is founded.

Events.html: 1924 – The 1924 Winter Olympics opens in Chamonix, in the French Alps, inaugurating the Winter Olympic Games.
Events.text: The 1924 Winter Olympics opens in Chamonix, in the French Alps, inaugurating the Winter Olympic Games.

Events.html: 1932 – Second Sino-Japanese War: The Chinese National Revolutionary Army begins its defense of Harbin.
Events.text: Second Sino-Japanese War: The Chinese National Revolutionary Army begins its defense of Harbin.

Events.html: 1937 – The Guiding Light debuts on NBC radio from Chicago. In 1952 it moves to CBS television, where it remains until Sept. 18, 2009.
Events.text: The Guiding Light debuts on NBC radio from Chicago. In 1952 it moves to CBS television, where it remains until Sept. 18, 2009.

Events.html: 1941 – Pope Pius XII elevates the Apostolic Vicariate of the Hawaiian Islands to the dignity of a diocese. It becomes the Roman Catholic Diocese of Honolulu.
Events.text: Pope Pius XII elevates the Apostolic Vicariate of the Hawaiian Islands to the dignity of a diocese. It becomes the Roman Catholic Diocese of Honolulu.

links.subject: Apostolic Vicariate of the Hawaiian Islands
links.title: Apostolic Vicariate of the Hawaiian Islands

Events.html: 1942 – World War II: Thailand declares war on the United States and United Kingdom.
Events.text: World War II: Thailand declares war on the United States and United Kingdom.

Events.html: 1944 – Florence Li Tim-Oi is ordained in China, becoming the first woman Anglican priest.
Events.text: Florence Li Tim-Oi is ordained in China, becoming the first woman Anglican priest.

Events.html: 1945 – World War II: The Battle of the Bulge ends.
Events.text: World War II: The Battle of the Bulge ends.

Events.html: 1946 – The United Mine Workers rejoins the American Federation of Labor.
Events.text: The United Mine Workers rejoins the American Federation of Labor.

Events.html: 1947 – Thomas Goldsmith Jr. files a patent for a "Cathode Ray Tube Amusement Device", the first ever electronic game.
Events.text: Thomas Goldsmith Jr. files a patent for a "Cathode Ray Tube Amusement Device", the first ever electronic game.

Events.html: 1949 – At the Hollywood Athletic Club the first Emmy Awards are presented.
Events.text: At the Hollywood Athletic Club the first Emmy Awards are presented.

Events.html: 1955 – The Soviet Union ends the state of war with Germany.
Events.text: The Soviet Union ends the state of war with Germany.

Events.html: 1960 – The National Association of Broadcasters reacts to the "payola" scandal by threatening fines for any disc jockeys who accept money for playing particular records.
Events.text: The National Association of Broadcasters reacts to the "payola" scandal by threatening fines for any disc jockeys who accept money for playing particular records.

Events.html: 1961 – In Washington, D.C. John F. Kennedy delivers the first live presidential television news conference.
Events.text: In Washington, D.C. John F. Kennedy delivers the first live presidential television news conference.

Events.html: 1969 – Brazilian Army captain Carlos Lamarca deserts in order to fight against the military dictatorship, taking with him 10 machine guns and 63 rifles.
Events.text: Brazilian Army captain Carlos Lamarca deserts in order to fight against the military dictatorship, taking with him 10 machine guns and 63 rifles.

Events.html: 1971 – Charles Manson and three female "Family" members are found guilty of the 1969 Tate-LaBianca murders.
Events.text: Charles Manson and three female "Family" members are found guilty of the 1969 Tate-LaBianca murders.

Events.html: 1971 – Idi Amin leads a coup deposing Milton Obote and becomes Uganda's president.
Events.text: Idi Amin leads a coup deposing Milton Obote and becomes Uganda's president.

Events.html: 1979 – Pope John Paul II starts his first official papal visits outside Italy to the Bahamas, Dominican Republic and Mexico.
Events.text: Pope John Paul II starts his first official papal visits outside Italy to the Bahamas, Dominican Republic and Mexico.

Events.html: 1980 – Mother Teresa is honored with India's highest civilian award, the Bharat Ratna
Events.text: Mother Teresa is honored with India's highest civilian award, the Bharat Ratna

Events.html: 1981 – Jiang Qing, the widow of Mao Zedong, is sentenced to death.
Events.text: Jiang Qing, the widow of Mao Zedong, is sentenced to death.

Events.html: 1986 – The National Resistance Movement topples the government of Tito Okello in Uganda.
Events.text: The National Resistance Movement topples the government of Tito Okello in Uganda.

Events.year: 1990 Avianca Flight 52 crashed into Cove Neck, New York due to fuel exuasion.
Events.html: 1990 Avianca Flight 52 crashed into Cove Neck, New York due to fuel exuasion.
1993 – Five people are shot outside the CIA headquarters in Langley, Virginia. Two are killed and three wounded.
Events.text: Five people are shot outside the CIA headquarters in Langley, Virginia. Two are killed and three wounded.

Events.html: 1994 – The Clementine space probe launches.
Events.text: The Clementine space probe launches.

Events.html: 1995 – The Norwegian rocket incident: Russia almost launches a nuclear attack after it mistakes Black Brant XII, a Norwegian research rocket, for a US Trident missile.
Events.text: The Norwegian rocket incident: Russia almost launches a nuclear attack after it mistakes Black Brant XII, a Norwegian research rocket, for a US Trident missile.

Events.html: 1996 – Billy Bailey becomes the last person to be hanged in the USA.
Events.text: Billy Bailey becomes the last person to be hanged in the USA.

Events.html: 1998 – During a historic visit to Cuba, Pope John Paul II demands political reforms and the release of political prisoners while condemning US attempts to isolate the country.
Events.text: During a historic visit to Cuba, Pope John Paul II demands political reforms and the release of political prisoners while condemning US attempts to isolate the country.

Events.html: 1998 – A suicide attack by the Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam on Sri Lanka's Temple of the Tooth kills eight and injures 25 others.
Events.text: A suicide attack by the Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam on Sri Lanka's Temple of the Tooth kills eight and injures 25 others.

Events.html: 1999 – A 6.0 Richter scale earthquake hits western Colombia killing at least 1,000.
Events.text: A 6.0 Richter scale earthquake hits western Colombia killing at least 1,000.

Events.html: 2003 – 2003 Invasion of Iraq: A group of people leave London, England, for Baghdad, Iraq, to serve as human shields, intending to prevent the U.S.-led coalition troops from bombing certain locations.
Events.text: 2003 Invasion of Iraq: A group of people leave London, England, for Baghdad, Iraq, to serve as human shields, intending to prevent the U.S.-led coalition troops from bombing certain locations.

Events.html: 2004 – Opportunity rover (MER-B) lands on surface of Mars.
Events.text: Opportunity rover (MER-B) lands on surface of Mars.

Events.html: 2005 – A stampede at the Mandhradevi temple in Maharashtra, India kills at least 258.
Events.text: A stampede at the Mandhradevi temple in Maharashtra, India kills at least 258.

Events.html: 2006 – Three independent observing campaigns announce the discovery of OGLE-2005-BLG-390Lb through gravitational microlensing, the first cool rocky/icy extrasolar planet around a main-sequence star.
Events.text: Three independent observing campaigns announce the discovery of OGLE-2005-BLG-390Lb through gravitational microlensing, the first cool rocky/icy extrasolar planet around a main-sequence star.

Events.html: 2006 – Mexican professional wrestler Juana Barraza is arrested in connection with the serial killing of at least 10 elderly women.
Events.text: Mexican professional wrestler Juana Barraza is arrested in connection with the serial killing of at least 10 elderly women.

Events.html: 2011 – The first wave of the Egyptian revolution begins in Egypt, with a series of street demonstrations, marches, rallies, acts of civil disobedience, riots, labour strikes, and violent clashes in Cairo, Alexandria, and throughout other cities in Egypt.
Events.text: The first wave of the Egyptian revolution begins in Egypt, with a series of street demonstrations, marches, rallies, acts of civil disobedience, riots, labour strikes, and violent clashes in Cairo, Alexandria, and throughout other cities in Egypt.

links.subject: first wave
links.title: Timeline of the 2011 Egyptian revolution under Hosni Mubarak's rule

Events.html: 2013 – At least 50 people are killed and 120 people are injured in a prison riot in Barquisimeto, Venezuela.
Events.text: At least 50 people are killed and 120 people are injured in a prison riot in Barquisimeto, Venezuela.
